    Tutorial

    April Wright

    11/16/2020

    00_package.Rmd

    The first thing that we usually want to include in a tutorial is how we can install the R package. Some of you have been able to push your R package to Github, some have not. But once you are able to, the syntax for installing those packages will look something like this:

    devtools::install_github("wrightaprilm/wright.package")

    The next thing that usually comes in a tutorial is reminding people to lead the package:

    library(wright.package)

    Data cleaning for phylogenetics

    Usually provide some rationale for why someone might need to do this analysis. In the next couple sentences, usually, you’ll explain how it works. So what kind of data will this function clean? What types of errors will it fix? What will be the output? What is expected to be in the input?

    library(readr)
ants <- read_csv("../inst/extdata/FossilAnts.csv")
    ##
